summary: An email from Susan Shelling to an unspecified recipient regarding receiving a subpoena related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case. Shelling states she took a deposition in the Epstein case in Palm Beach County years earlier, believes the transcript exists, and that her notes were destroyed after five years. She claims to have no memory of the deposition.

persons.name: Susan Shelling
persons.context: Author of the email who states she took a deposition in the Epstein case in Palm Beach County years ago and has received a subpoena related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The case referenced in the subpoena received by Susan Shelling.

connections.description: Shelling received a subpoena related to the Maxwell case, likely because she previously took a deposition in the related Epstein case.

events.title: Deposition in Epstein case
events.description: Susan Shelling states she took a deposition in the Epstein case in Palm Beach County several years prior to 2021.

events.title: Subpoena received re Maxwell case
events.description: Susan Shelling received a subpoena related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: Susan Shelling took a deposition in the Epstein case in Palm Beach County several years before September 2021.
Shelling received a subpoena related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case in September 2021.
Shelling states any notes she had from the Epstein deposition were destroyed as it was more than five years ago.
Shelling claims to have no memory of the Epstein deposition whatsoever.
Shelling believes the deposition was transcribed and that the recipient of her email has the transcript.
